titles: Dick the plow-man turn'd doctor. Or, The love-sick maiden cured. Shewing how a country maid in Kent fell in love with her fellow-servant Dick the plow-man, aud [sic] how he cured her of her sick distemper, &c. To the tune of, O mother Roger, &c. This may be printed, R.P.
publisher: Printed for C. Dennisson, at the Stationers-Arms within Aldgate.,
notes: Verse: "You maidens all of London city ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
